alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 7:20PM EST until January 12 at 3:15AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Connecticut... Yantic River near Yantic affecting New London County. For the Yantic River...including Yantic...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Yantic River near Yantic. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:46 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:46 PM EST Wednesday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 5.7 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.8 feet on 03/05/1934. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Yantic River Yantic 9.0 10.8 Wed 6 pm EST 5.9 4.3 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 730 AM EST.
